file_content.text: This might give us our edge in the war against the rakghouls.
Hopefully, the Republic will agree to suspend our operations until rakghoul territories have been better studied.
The Republic sent a unit to retrieve our team's bodies. They said to thank you for your help.
You're not going to ask if they went after your pet project?
Aren't you going to ask if she went after your pet project?
Aren't you going to ask if he wasted his time on your pet project?
Why do you always try to ruin everything? Do Sullustan moms not hug their children or something?
Um... did you get to the bombardment site? I don't see a scratch on you.
The rakghouls didn't want to give up their blood, but I convinced them.
I have the samples.
I'm sure you can be quite... persuasive.
Can you check right now? I want to see if anything comes of this.
Let's see if this was a waste.
It was easy.
Well, you've certainly got her all google-eyed at the lot of you.
Well, you've certainly got her drooling over you.
Aw, is that hero worship I see there?
Just let me see the samples. I've got a portable scanner that can give us preliminary results right....
Now.
That's amazing. There's over a fifty percent correlation. Genetic drift usually means a much less marked connection even in a normal population after so many years.
It should not surprise us that rakghouls retain some memory of their lives.
Even a dog shows loyalty.
Many animals show emotion toward their dead. It doesn't mean they think.
They cling so desperately to their lost humanity.
I almost feel for them.
It could just be geography, remaining close to their initial infection site. We'll need a xenobiologist out to study this--
Don't just dismiss it now! This is an incredible find!
Does that give us any insight into how to defeat them?
Talk tactics.
If we know they defend a territory, then we know where to avoid... or even how to draw them out.
But consider what you're saying! This means rakghouls have remnants of sentience. We can't kill them.
So, they're not just related, they're inbred?
The family tree doesn't fork?
Guess they're not any pickier about their mates than their food.
How can you joke about this? This is incredible. There's no way this is coincidence.
They really are defending their ancestors, then?
What does that mean?
It means we just made one of the most important discoveries in Tarisian history.
I'll skip the science.
You can't leave now! Did you hear what she said? This is amazing.
What? Where's the cynical disbelief?
You can't dispute the numbers, Cera. You're right. This is amazing.
If rakghouls have enough rationality to remember people and places that matter to them, we can't keep treating them like mindless animals.
They've slaughtered millions of people, including your friends.
They're still monsters.
If they can think, maybe someday we can make peace with them.
You think they're sentient?
Exactly.
That's a disturbing thought.
We need to cancel our operations in these grave sites. We can't keep antagonizing them.
But if we know they come to the defense of certain territories, we can bait them, draw them out so the Republic can send in troops to exterminate them.
No! If they're sentient, we can't just keep murdering them.
I'll contact the Reconstruction Authority. Do you have an opinion on this?
If there's any way to coexist peacefully with the rakghouls, we should take it.
You should study this further.
I--I guess it's a virtue to forgive, right?
At least this way, maybe we can avoid those kinds of attacks in the future.
Rakghouls are a contagious, predatory species. Our only option is to wipe them out.
Kill them all.
Isn't that the thinking that got Elihsu and the others killed?
You can't reason with a monster, Garthe. You of all people should know that.
I'll give the Republic your recommendation. Thank you again for all your help.
This will be the only data ever brought back from one of the main bombardment sites.
Did you notice anything about the number of rakghouls in that pipe? I think it's more than most places, right?
Oh, not that nonsense again....
You sound like there's something more on your mind.
What's going on?
Is this leading up to something?
More nonsense?
Okay, this'll sound crazy--but there's more rakghouls at our grave sites than any of the Republic target zones.
They're just drawn to the noise and the smell of flesh.
We're not any noisier or... fleshier than a platoon of soldiers. I think they're protecting their ancestors.
Ancestors?
What do you mean?
See, rakghouls descend from sentients. It's a disease. One we know little about.
Rakghouls are beasts. Everyone knows they're not sentient.
Impossible.
I'm not saying they discuss it over tea, but I think something is driving them to defend these grave sites.
They were human once, you know. The first ones, anyway. It's a disease that turned them into monsters. And we still don't understand how it works.
Why should I care?
All we know about rakghouls right now is they have a disease that can turn people into monsters, and they've taken over all of Taris.
But if my theory is correct, it'll be our first insight into how they think.
This could be a first step toward taking the planet back from them.
Understanding your enemy is the key to defeating him.
Can I assist in this?
Exactly. Right now, rakghouls are like something out of a nightmare. We never know when or where they'll attack.
Only if we look through their eyes can we understand what they see.
A worthy goal.
I kind of hope they're really the beasts they seem. Imagine if there's still a sentient person, trapped inside....
There's nothing worse than fighting something too dumb to do the same thing twice.
Good strategy.
There's nothing scarier than never knowing when or where they might swarm in.
Still seems like a long shot, unless you can sit them down and ask.
I guess....
I think there's a way. Now that you're here, anyway.
You're not sending them to the bombardment site, are you? That place is so thick with rakghouls you can see them from orbit!
Don't you interfere! We know what you think of the people of Taris. I'm right about this. Why else would they be so determined to guard the bombardment sites?
Exactly! Why so many rakghouls at the bombardment sites unless they're staying near their human ancestors?
Can you prove it?
The salvage team can't get to the main bombardment sites.
There are so many rakghouls there, you can see them by satellite, like a living carpet.
If you could get samples from both the rakghouls and the skeletons at one of the main sites, we could see if they're related.
My specialty--danger and a worthy cause.
Sounds fun.
Great. The closest bombardment site is southeast of the Republic base. Believe me, you can't miss it.
Do you have details? What exactly are we talking about?
What will that entail?
The closest bombardment site is southeast of the base. You won't be able to miss it.
There probably isn't a way to get a rakghoul to volunteer a genetic sample, so, um, I guess you'll be killing them.
Then we'll compare their blood samples with genetic material from corpses in the same area.
By tomorrow, you should be able to answer this question once and for all.
Sounds like a deal.
This is ridiculous. Are you really going to take up more of their time with your crazy theories?
No. Cera, you cannot take up any more of her time with these ridiculous theories--
Seriously, Cera, you think you can waste his valuable time on your crackpot theories?
You don't tell me what to do anymore! We know how you feel about the people of Taris.
Let them decide if it's worth it.
It's her choice if she thinks it's worth it.
He's smart. He wouldn't do this if he didn't think there was a point.
Please don't let Garthe discourage you. This is important. And I don't think there's anyone else on this planet willing to brave those rakghouls to find out.
I'll be waiting to hear what you find.
Any payment?
The bombardment site is chock-full of salvage no one's ever managed to get to--
You never change, do you?
No! Those are important archaeological artifacts, not some kind of... pirate treasure.
But I'm sure the Republic will pay something for the data. I'll give you whatever they offer.
Thank you again. I'll be waiting to see what you find.
And maybe it's psychic vibrations in the sun spots. I've got better things to do.
Sounds ridiculous.
I told you no one cares about your crackpot theories, Cera. Stick to counting bones. Let someone else do the science.
Shut up and wait to be arrested.
Really. I think I can prove it....
Then I'll say "thank you" and leave it at that. Come back if you change your mind.
You're back! And... I don't see anyone with you. Did you...? A--are they...?
Dead? What did you think? The rakghouls would buy them flowers and send them home?
I'm sorry. Your friends are gone, but I made sure those rakghouls will never kill again.
I was too late.
Cold comfort. There's probably another swarm already moving in.
He's right.
If you killed those freaks, I'll call it even. At least we can clear out the corpses without becoming one.
Excuse me. I--I should call the base, tell their families what happened.
Actually, one of them left you a message, Garthe....
I learned a few things.
A message? Oh, that must be Elihsu. They were very close.
I'll call the base and tell them what happened.
I'm putting in for a transfer. No job is worth this.
I hear you've found a way to make it worth your while.
Is that why you're stealing?
Wha--what did you find? Was Elihsu alive? What did that lying coward say about me?
You should have more respect for those murdered by the Sith.
It's wrong to rob the dead.
Three hundred years ago! All the Sith involved are just as dead as them.
Elihsu says he knows how the dead feel now when you desecrate them.
The dead deserve more respect.
I've given five years of my life to this rock!
Now that's worth nothing because I laid claim to a few forgotten necklaces?
It's the Republic you've been stealing from, not just the dead.
I'll see you court-martialed.
The Republic doesn't care what we find! I gave them five years of my life--not a raise, not a trip home--we're all forgotten.
So, fine. You found me out. Who cares?
Greed's one thing, Garthe, but grave robbing's just low.
Your secret's out.
Okay, fine. So I'm sending some trinkets into the black market instead of Republic archives. So what?
He said you've been stealing from the dead.
He left a confession.
So dramatic. It's nothing big. The corpses are still filed; the data is preserved.
It was just stuff--jewelry, mostly. No one was going to miss it.
You're talking about people who died generations ago!
The message Elihsu left should be worth good money to hear. And keep quiet.
What's it worth to you?
What is this, blackmail? Are you accusing me of a crime or committing one?
We'll see if you think prisoners have as few rights as the dead.
I'm turning you in.
Very funny.
With what you've been making off these corpses, you can share.
Pay me and I'll keep quiet.
Fine. Take Elihsu's share. He won't be needing it.
The commander's sending a team to retrieve the bodies. Thank you for doing what you could.
I also uncovered Garthe's crime. He's been stealing off the bodies.
Your partner's a thief.
Ask your partner what's been happening to the valuables you find.
Garthe's got a confession.
One of your dead teammates has evidence of a crime.
Tell them to check the bodies.
Oh, please. This is so humiliating. Yes, Elihsu and I were stealing some trinkets for the black market. The blasted dead don't cry over it, why should you?
How could you! You told me those boxes were going to the Republic archive.
Yeah, so I lied. What... you going to turn me in for that, too?
We'll work this out later--we've asked enough of your time. Although... if you have a moment....
At least you'll be able to retrieve the bodies.
I wish I could have done more.
If the blasted rakghouls don't come back. They're everywhere.
Rakghouls are nothing.
Well, for us, it would have been impossible. So thank you.
Not like the rakghoul freaks don't show back up the minute you kill one. They're everywhere.
Mostly around us. Which makes me wonder....
If you don't have another job for me, I should be going.
Is there anything else?
Actually, there is something. The number of rakghouls that were in that pipe... I think it's more than in most places, right?
This has taken enough of my time.
Then goodbye.
Well, thanks for going in. You showed more concern than the Republic ever has.
Wait, you're not leaving, are you? I wanted to... that is, you did us such a favor--could I maybe... ask another?
I turned around and there was no one behind me. There's so many of them still lost in that pipe....
Thank you for coming so fast! I told you the commander would send someone, Garthe!
You think they're from base? You ever seen a regulation group of soldiers look like that?
Okay, maybe. But that doesn't mean they can't help us. Please, sirs, have any of you ever faced a rakghoul?
The commander didn't send her!
The commander didn't send him!
Don't you recognize a Jedi when you see one?
Then we really are saved! Master Jedi, may I please beg your aid? Have you ever faced a rakghoul before?
A lieutenant on duty wouldn't be out here without a full squad.
On duty or not, please... sir... do you have any experience with rakghouls?
That's not any uniform I've ever seen.
She got here on her own somehow, past all the rakghouls. She could still help us.
He managed to get out here past all the rakghouls. He could still help us.
Is this a research station or something?
What are you doing here?
We're a Republic archaeological salvage team cataloging those who died in the Tarisian bombardment. Mostly they call us the "corpse counters."
Rakghouls are nothing.
Really? Because they're the most terrifying things I've ever seen. Dragged down three quarters of our team before we could do anything.
You look pretty secure here.
What's so urgent?
Rakghouls dragged off most of our team. We don't know if anyone's still alive, but if they are, every second counts.
We're a Republic archaeological salvage team. They call us the "corpse counters" because we're cataloging the bodies from the bombardment.
We were in an old Czerka Works pipe this morning when those monsters came out of nowhere. They killed our guards and half a dozen of our team.
They might not be dead. We ran, we didn't see. Could you please... just check if anyone survived?
The Republic is risking your lives to gather up some ancient bones?
You're counting bodies?
It's important work--
It's pointless work! People are dying out here so the Republic can have a list they'll never look at.
These people deserve someone to acknowledge their deaths.
Only... most of our team were lost this morning when rakghouls cut us off. I was hoping... that you might go see if anyone is still alive.
If there is any chance your friends live, they deserve every effort to save them.
I'll go right now.
Thank you. I'm honored that you would help us.
A life snuffed out to feed a monster--I will leave no one to that fate.
I will rescue them.
To think a virus can turn a sentient being into one of those creatures....
Don't expect miracles. If your friends have been gone long, there's not much hope.
I'll try.
That's what I've been saying. Rakghouls don't leave survivors. They just make more rakghouls.
Someone could have hid... you never know!
I wouldn't want to be the one left behind in a hole full of those things.
I'll give it a shot.
I wanted to go back for them--
Don't be ridiculous, Cera. Then we'd just be dead, too.
Might give it a shot.
Thank you. It means a lot, knowing we're not abandoning them.
We were in the Czerka Works pipeline. If you go soon, there may still be someone there.
No. There's no hope for our friends now... but maybe you can make those monsters pay for what they did.
Not my job. [Refuse quest]
More important than people's lives?
Forget it. [Refuse quest]
But they could die!
Let it go, Cera. They're dead already. Another few hours won't matter.
Do you think this jawbone goes with that skull or this one?
And what about our deaths? Who'll remember those?
No one deserves to end their life in the belly of a rakghoul.
I'll try to help your friends.
The dead need an advocate.
Your work is important.
Then please, help us. The rakghouls hit our team this morning inside the Czerka Works pipeline. We had to leave them. If anyone's still alive, they don't have much time.
This better be quick.
Fascinating.
You lost me.
You lost me.
